properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a FieldCollection to verify the connection between the add-in and Word application before performing field operations.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

examples.description: Retrieve all fields from the document body and display their code and result values in the console.

methods.name: getByTypes
methods.description: Gets the Field object collection including the specified types of fields.

examples.description: Get all hyperlink and page reference fields from the document and display their count in the console.

methods.name: getFirst
methods.description: Gets the first field in this collection. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if this collection is empty.

examples.description: Get the first field in the document and display its code

methods.name: getFirstOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the first field in this collection. If this collection is empty, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

examples.description: Retrieve and display the properties (code, result, type, locked status, data, and kind) of the first field in the document, or indicate if no fields exist.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the result text of all fields in the document

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.FieldCollection` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.FieldCollectionData`) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

examples.description: Serialize field collection data to JSON format for logging or data export purposes

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track all fields in a document to monitor and update their values across multiple sync calls without encountering InvalidObjectPath errors

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Load all fields in a document, process them, then untrack the collection to free memory
